novel.title: BIGFOOT'S SHOE
synopsis: A coming of age tale for the modern world.
Werewolves, vampires, and romance.
A mysterious island. A mysterious man. A mysterious past. A mysterious shoe.
Pop-up pictures inside.
A gripping thriller set in the world of competitive footwear.
Based on true events.
The book Oprah would recommend if she knew about it.
An unflinching look at the American healthcare system.
A man hits creatures in the face with a steel pipe and then checks into a hotel.
A security guard recruits a dying man to dig up a giant invisible shoe in the desert.
Features a lengthy conversation with a wall.
The hero's greatest achievement is grabbing a demon.
A man walks down identical hallways for an unspecified amount of time.
Contains a detailed legal framework for how hell works.
God appears briefly on a door but his face has been scratched off.
A man covered in other people's regrets is told this is a gift.
The villain is a judge whose legal strategy is to just yell guilty over and over.
A bailiff who navigates by smell.
The hero's mentor dies :(.
Bigfoot is real but only his foot is visible.
A man is saved by listening to his own heartbeat.
A retired section of hell is used as a library.
Contains a pyramid covered in regret.
A giant invisible shoe calls to the stars and a stone giant answers.
The hero loses a fight to a slimey basketball.
Features a scene where a man tries not to step on the cracks to stay sane.
A courtroom drama where the jury is unconscious.
Over 20,000 pages.
Not yet banned in any country.
A novel.
The shoe is not a metaphor. There is a literal shoe.
This description changes every time you load the page.
You just missed the good description.
A travel memoir.
novel.message: The author is currently reworking the beginning after finally figuring out the ending. Chapters will appear here as they’re ready.
